ul.li1: 1And it will be that at the end of those days,
the mountain of Yahweh
ul.li2: will be established as the highest of the mountains,
ul.li1: and it will be lifted up above the hills,
ul.li2: and people will stream to it.
ul.li1: 2And many nations will come and say,
“Come! Let us go up to the mountain of Yahweh,
ul.li2: and to the templeLiterally “house” of the God of Jacob,
ul.li1: that he may teach us his ways,
ul.li2: and that we may walk in his paths,”
ul.li1: for the law will go out from Zion,
ul.li2: and the word of Yahweh from Jerusalem.
ul.li1: 3And he will judge between many peoples
ul.li2: and will arbitrate for strong nations far away;
ul.li1: and they will beat their swords into plowshares
ul.li2: and their spears into pruning hooks;
ul.li1: nation will not lift up a sword against a nation,
ul.li2: and they will no longer learn war.
ul.li1: 4But they will sit, each under his vine
ul.li2: and under his fig tree,
ul.li1: and no one will make them afraid,
ul.li2: for the mouth of Yahweh of hosts has spoken.
ul.li1: 5For all the nations walk,
ul.li2: each in the name of its god,
ul.li1: but we will walk in the name of Yahweh our God,
ul.li2: forever and ever.

ul.li1: 6“In that day,” declares Yahweh,Literally “a declaration of Yahweh”
ul.li2: “I will assemble the one who limps,
ul.li1: and I will gather the one who has been scattered,
ul.li2: and those whom I have mistreated.
ul.li1: 7And I will make the one who limps a remnant,
ul.li2: and the one driven far away a strong nation,
ul.li1: and Yahweh will reign over them on Mount Zion
ul.li2: from now to forever.
ul.li1: 8And you, O Migdal-Eder,Or “tower of the flock”
ul.li2: hill of the daughter of Zion,
ul.li1: to you it will come,
ul.li2: and the former dominion will come,
the reign of the daughter of Jerusalem.
ul.li1: 9So then, why do you shout a loud shout?
ul.li2: Is there no king in you?
ul.li1: Has your counselor perished
ul.li2: that pangs like a woman in labor have seized you?
ul.li1: 10Writhe and groan, O daughter of Zion,
ul.li2: like a woman in labor.
ul.li1: For now you will go forth from the city,
ul.li2: and you will camp in the field;
you will go to Babylon.
ul.li1: There you will be rescued;
ul.li2: there Yahweh will redeem you
from the hand of your enemies.
ul.li1: 11And now, many nations are gathered against you
ul.li2: who are saying, ‘Let her be defiled,
and let our eyes gaze upon Zion.’
ul.li1: 12But they do not know the thoughts of Yahweh,
ul.li2: and they do not understand his plan,
ul.li1: that he has gathered them as sheaves
ul.li2: to his threshing floor.
ul.li1: 13Arise and thresh, O daughter of Zion,
ul.li2: for your horn I will make as iron
and your hooves as bronze.
ul.li1: And you will break many peoples in pieces,
ul.li2: and their gain you will devote to destruction to Yahweh,
and their wealth to the Lord of the whole earth.”
